• C O D E  B R E A K

    21
    December

    About

    The Department of Computer Science Engineering and Information Technology, School of Engineering presents "Codebreak 1.0” ​.

    You'll have 26 hours to come up with a solution, in the domain you wish to challenge. There are open themes such as AI, Blockchain, Cloud,...and emerging technologies.

    You're free to choose any platform for the development of the solution.

    MIT-ADT is conducting this Mega Hackathon for the first time in Pune. It will provide programmers, developers, designers and inventors all over the nation, a chance to showcase their skills and creativity through technology.

    21
    December

    FAQ


    • Is there a hackathon code of conduct?

      https://devfolio.co/code-of-conduct

    • Is there reimbursement for travel?

      Yes, we do offer reimbursement for travel expenses provided valid travel bills are shown. This is applicable only for the first 10 registrations out of Pune as of now.

    • Who owns my project?

      Project is owned by the team who has developed it.

    • What are the criteria for evaluation?

      The judges will analyze and evaluate all projects submitted by the teams based on Concept, Development, Design and Presentation.

    • What are the rewards?

      There are cash rewards based on the position secured respectively.

    • What will be provided during the hackathon?

      Wi-fi access, a welcome kit, food throughout the hackathon.

    • When is the deadline for application?

      The last date to apply is 30th November 2019

    • What are the things required for me to bring for the hackathon?

      This is a very hands-on event. Things required will be your college ID cards, laptop, mobile phones and any other tools needed by you (USB drive, charging devices, extension cord, mouse, etc.).

    • Will accommodation be provided?

      Yes, accommodation will be provided one day before the hackathon starts. The rest provisions are there during the event.

    • Who can participate ?

      College students who have valid ID cards, along with government IDs.

    • How do I participate? What are the criteria for participation?

      There is a link provided on the website through which you can register yourself. Criteria for participation are: The participant must be a student. You can participate in groups of minimum 2 and maximum 4.
